bibl.author: William Stansberry
bibl.title: William Stansberry to Walt Whitman, 28 June 1874
bibl.orgName: Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

body.p:
I Received your kind & Most Welcome Letter A Short time Ago And I Have Received 22 New Pappers Newspapers And It is Hard For me to you How thankful I am to you for them. I Wander Wonder How you Could think what was So Gratifying to us. Well My Health I But Very little Better But If I Had Stayed In W Va West Virginia I dont don't Suppose I would Have Been Living Now. I am Sorry to know your Health is So Poor But I which wish you would come to Minnesota and I do think
you would get your Health Better their there is People coming From Almost Every State to Howard Lake For their Health. Dear Friend you Said In your Letter Prehaps Perhaps We Would Meet Meet know more In this world But I Do feel As this Pleashure Pleasure will Come to me Before I Leave this world A Pleashure Pleasure I do So Mutch Much Desire For I think My Joy would Bee Be
unsheakable unshakable to meet a Friend that was So good & kind to me As you was when I was In Washington. But I Hope If We Do Not Meet In this world we will meet in Heaven.
Being In the army & Loosing Loosing my Health So I am Not Able to work of Corse Course we are Poor But when I went In the army I had a Comfortable Home As a Life

My Mother Leives Lives In W Va West Virginia My Father Is Dead Tongue Can Not Express How Much I think of My Mother And well I would Like to See Her I Have Not Seen Her For 8 year My Brothers & Sisters Lives their there
to too
I Will Close My letter By Saying I Hope you will get your Health
My Wife Send Her Best Respects to you And Says tell you She thanks you for your kindness And Care to me
My Children Sends their Love to you Now My Dear Friend I Hope you will write Soon

postscript.p: My Parents Came From New Jersey Not Far From Camden they was Born their there
